artist: Artist: Étienne Delaune; Artist: After Luca Penni
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude male figure lying with PL arm over head; PR arm stretched over body, holding onto a spear; angels and cupids in clouds above looking on sadly; wild boar at L; trees on cliff
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp

in graphite on verso: G40 | R-D 102 | and illegible handwriting: [by deLacilne?]
markings:
on verso: blue stamp, at left: Dr. K.O., not in Lugt (possibly Dr. Karl Max Osthof); black stamp, LR: Hugo Ahne, Aussig, not in Lugt;* brown stamp, in center: Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staaliche Kunstsammlungen duplicate, Lugt 1618; on recto: black stamp cut off at base of print, Friedrich August II de Saxe, Lugt 972

* Ahne is possibly the same collector born Vienna 1875, died Munich 1964, who focused on small Renaissance graphics from Nuremberg, per \"Knizni Znacka,\" March 2014.
provenance: Friedrich August II de Saxe (1797-1854), Lugt 972, Dresden. Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staaliche Kunstsammlungen duplicate, Lugt 1618, Dresden; sale around 1885. Hugo Ahne, Aussig (not in Lugt). Dr. K.O. (possibly Dr. Karl Max Osthof) (not in Lugt). John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and dated in plate, bottom center: [STE. F. 1569]; inscribed in plate at upper left: [L. PEN. IN]
title: Venus, Three Graces, and Cupid Mourning the Death of Adonis
